http://matthewlein.com/ceaser/
2 column div layout: right column with fixed width, left fluid
=======================================================================

Example HTML:
--------------
<div class="container">
     <div class="right">
         right content fixed width
     </div>
     <div class="left">
         left content flexible width
     </div>
</div>

CSS:
-----------------
.container {
     height: auto;
     overflow: hidden;
}

.right {
     width: 180px;
     float: right;
     background: #aafed6;
}

.left {
     float: none; /* not needed, just for clarification */
     background: #e8f6fe;
     /* the next props are meant to keep this block independent from the other floated one */
     width: auto;
     overflow: hidden;
}​​

c:article.c:title: Angular Material
c:article.c:abstract:
The Angular Material project is an implementation of Material Design in Angular.js. This project provides a set of reusable, well-tested, and accessible UI components based on the Material Design system.

Similar to the Polymer project's Paper elements collection, Angular Material is supported internally at Google by the Angular.js, Material Design UX and other product teams.

c:article.c:title: Underscore
c:article.c:abstract: Underscore provides over 100 functions that support both your favorite workaday functional helpers: map, filter, invoke — as well as more specialized goodies: function binding, javascript templating, creating quick indexes, deep equality testing, and so on.

c:article.c:title: Token-Based Authentication With AngularJS & NodeJS
c:article.c:abstract: Authentication is one of the most important parts of any web application. In this tutorial, we'll be discussing token-based authentication systems and how they differ from traditional login systems. At the end of this tutorial, you'll see a fully working demo written in AngularJS and NodeJS

c:article.c:title: Enabling and Disabling SELinux
c:article.c:abstract: If the system was initially installed without SELinux, particularly the selinux-policy package, which was added to the system later, one additional step is necessary to enable SELinux. To make sure SELinux is initialized during system startup, the dracut utility has to be run to put SELinux awareness into the initramfs file system. Failing to do so causes SELinux not to start during system startup.

c:article.c:title: Comparison block helper for handlebars templates
c:article.c:abstract:
I really like the handlebars template system, it’s straight to the point, efficient, and the added logic layer to mustache makes it practical for most scenarios.

One limitation i’ve found was that if block helpers can’t actually evaluate an expression, it only tests if the passed value is already true or false, there’s no evaluation of it.

http://codyrushing.com/using-handlebars-helpers-on-both-client-and-server/

c:article.c:title: Start a new Node.js Express app the right way
c:article.c:abstract: npm install -g express-generator Node.js is extremely popular and no doubt you’ve seen some amazing work being done with it. Getting started can be tricky because of a few things: Node.js is a flexible, powerful tool that can be used to build many different types of projects, from server applications, to websites, to utilities. Also, because it is still an emerging tool with an explosive rate of growth, there are many ways to do the same thing and it’s hard to tell what tools and processes to use.

c:article.c:title: Write a todo list with Express and MongoDB
c:article.c:abstract: A todo list website is a good practice to learn a programing language or a framework. It shows you how to create, read, update and delete records. In this post we are going to use Express as our application framework and MongoDB as our data store.

c:article.c:title: Responsive Equal Height Blocks
c:article.c:abstract: It's virtually dividing the list into rows, picking the height of the highest item in each row, and setting it for the other corresponding row items in a responsive way

c:article.c:title: Restive.JS
c:article.c:abstract:
Restive.JS is a lightweight JQuery Framework (note the JQuery dependency) that allows developers to better handle responsive design. It provides a bunch of useful classes and identifiers that makes it easier for developers to target specific widths, orientations, even devices. Please have a look, I find it very exciting.
http://speckyboy.com/2014/04/24/make-any-website-responsive/
